Name: Flumorph
Description: Flumorph is a mixture comprising approximately equal amounts of (E)- and (Z)-fluomorph. It is used as an agrochemical fungicide for the control oomcyetes such as downey mildew on vegetables and grapes. It has a role as an antifungal agrochemical. It is a mixture and a morpholine fungicide. It contains a (Z)-flumorph and an (E)-flumorph.

plant_translocations.content: The absorption, transmission, and distribution behavior and mechanism of flumorpholine in cucumber plants were studied using bioassay techniques and high-performance liquid chromatography. The results showed that flumorpholine can be passively absorbed by cucumber plants and transmitted and distributed in vivo through the xylem
plant_translocations.reference: Shu-Sheng, Z., **-Li, L., Jian-Qiang, L., & Nai-Guo, S. (2006). Uptake and translocation behavior of new fungicide flumorph in cucumber plant. CHEMICAL JOURNAL OF CHINESE UNIVERSITIES-CHINESE, 27(10), 1887-1890.

method.Apply Location: Foliar application on detached leaves and root and leaf application on live plants
method.Plant Grown Condition: Plants were grown in a growth chamber at 100% humidity, 19°C, and 12-hour light-dark cycles for 7 days after inoculation with cucumber downy mildew fungus using the drop method
method.Chemical Preparation: Different concentrations of flumorph (100, 150, and 200g/mL) and control fungicides metalaxyl (systemic fungicide) and mancozeb (non-systemic fungicide) were used for root immersion of cucumber plants in groups of five plants each.
method.Pesticide Application Details for the Pl: : flumorph and control fungicides with bidirectional activity were sprayed on the leaves of cucumber plants at concentrations of 500 and 1000g/mL after they reached the three-leaf stage. In another set of plants at the three-leaf stage, flumorph and control fungicides were sprayed on the second leaf at concentrations of 100, 200, and 300g/mL, respectively. Samples were taken at different time points for each treatment.
method.Other Information: Each treatment step was repeated three times.
